message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with a graph layout problem, specifically the cutwidth of a semi-complete digraph. This problem is related to tournaments and feedback arc set, which are topics in discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and graph theory (cs.DS). The algorithmic techniques used in the paper involve dynamic programming and divide-and-conquer, which are common in computational geometry (cs.CG) and algorithm design and analysis (cs.DS). The paper also mentions the Optimal Linear Arrangement problem, which is a problem in combinatorial optimization (cs.CC) and closely related to Feedback Arc Set. Therefore, the most likely categories are cs.DM and cs.DS, followed by cs.CG, cs.GT, and cs.CC.
